title: Electric force - 2Q and 3Q at d vs 2Q and 9Q at 2d

content.question: Two small spheres have charges of <math alttext="2 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></math> and <math alttext="3 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>Q</mi></math>. When their centers are separated by a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>, they exert an electrostatic force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> on each other. What is the magnitude of the force exerted on two other spheres that have charges of <math alttext="2 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></math> and <math alttext="9 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>9</mn><mi>Q</mi></math> when their centers are a distance <math alttext="2 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></math> apart?

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
